website_summaries.verdict: Ditching gimmicks and delivering on function, Razer's slim 14-inch gaming laptop marries true power and good battery life in an excellent PC. All it lacks a stellar display.
pros: The Razer Blade 14 has a slim design with a powerful combination of fourth-gen quad-core Intel processor and Nvidia graphics
cons: A lackluster low-resolution, nontouch display doesn't fit the high-end design.
The baseline 128GB SSD for $1,800 isn’t sufficient for a gaming PC
you'd better pony up for the 256GB or 512GB model

customer_reviews.title: The hardware on this laptop is great except the screen
customer_reviews.text: The hardware on this laptop is great except the screen. I didn't think it would bother me as much but after using top of the line laptops, it's very difficult to handle a cheap screen from the 90's where you have to angle it perfectly just to get a good picture. What good is a gaming laptop with a crappy screen? Even doing everyday things like watching Netflix makes it very annoying. Don't make the mistake I made after being so drawn to the hardware specs that I figure the complaints about the screen was just people being picky. Turns out it's just not worth having all that power working on a very bad quality display.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Lu

customer_reviews.title: Razer Blade 14
customer_reviews.text: Well! I've finally received my unit and first off, this thing is sexy and slim! Razer did an incredible job and I am most certainly pleased. I won't bore anyone by heading into the details highlighted by my fellow reviewers but as I go through the paces with this baby I'll probably post my findings. Enjoy the additional pictures I posted for viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Dami

customer_reviews.title: Fast and light
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is impressively fast even on the newest games. The screen viewing angle is a bit rough but its an excellent trade off considering the complete lack of motion blur that you get on most laptop screens. There are a few extras you will/may need before gaming. - Headphone Y combiner: If your headphone/mic is two plugs you will need a Y cable to combine them into 1 - Gaming Keypad: If your left thumb touches the mouse pad while gaming it will fire your weapon. This can be solved by using a separate gaming keypad to take your hand off the keyboard. This also avoids any uncomfortable heat from the laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Willuz

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, disappointed in service.
customer_reviews.text: Updated after a year and a half of ownership: The laptop is sleek and powerful as advertised, but the service is a problem. There are NO authorized service facilities anywhere outside California. And no plans to get them, And they will not sell you parts to perform repairs yourself. All repairs, no matter how minor, must be done at the factory. That means fed-exing the unit, getting a diagnosis, getting a price, (paying $100 if you don't agree to the price) then waiting for the repair and then fed-exing the thing back. Every other laptop manufacturer will sell parts to authorized repair shops. Beautiful laptop, but what a colossal pain.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Quinto

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop!
customer_reviews.text: Even though its fairly light it still feels solid and expensive. It's super fast and I haven't had any real problems with it other than moving the cursor while typing. It does get pretty hot when gaming but that's expected being it has an aluminum body. The screen resolution and viewing angle could have been better but it hasn't really been an issue for me and games look incredible on it. Keeping it clean is somewhat of a chore but that's just because it looks so good when its clean. I'm not gonna lie I bought it because in my opinion it's the best "portable" gaming laptop out there.
customer_reviews.author: Floris

customer_reviews.title: A Great Laptop
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best laptop I have ever owned. I had considered the Macbook Pro but needed the windows operating system for my business. I love this laptop because it is sturdy, powerful and compact. In fact it is very similar to the Apple but uses Windows 8.1 which takes some getting used to but works great. I especially like the fact that is has a solid state hard drive, a built in graphics card and a lighted keyboard. I upgraded to windows 8.1 Pro and got "bitlocker" for free. Overall, this laptop is a great value for the price and I would highly recommend it for business and personal use.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: This laptop is simply amazing. Anyone who says otherwise did not use it. It's light, thin, feels solid and it's blazingly fast. No other laptop this thin and light even comes close. The processor is fast, but it's true power is also in the NVidia graphics card. The battery is great as well. 8 hours at least! And people complaining about the screen? It's true, the angle has to be set up just right, but once it's good, the screen is fine. I personally like the fact other people can't check everything I do on my laptop... The price tag is steep, but if you are serious about your mobile workstation you cannot find a better companion...

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little laptop for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife, who needed something smaller than a hulking giant from Alienware that she had been using. The first unit that arrived: DOA. The graphics hardware caused "sparkles" whenever anything moved on screen. Returned that, and Amazon shipped the replacement immediately. The second unit was perfect. On battery and gaming, the unit gets a little warm and the battery will last about an hour with heavy gaming. With just websurfing or light work, considerably longer and cooler. It's completely silent. Windows 8 sucks -- there's no redemption for that. However, one nice bonus about this laptop is that it comes with *no* crapware. Vendors, listen up: a clean system is a fast and reliable system.
